title: Fundamentals and Applications of Soft Pneumatic Actuator Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic engineering knowledge and foundational understanding of physics and materials science
context.additional_context: Pre-service teachers acquire theoretical and practical principles of pneumatic actuator design—a core technology in soft robotics—while analyzing real-world applications (e.g., lifting objects)

learning_goals: Learners can explain the basic structure and operating principles of soft pneumatic actuators (SPA).
Learners can mathematically model pressure-strain-load relationships, interpret experimental data, and optimize designs.
Learners can design SPA membranes under given load conditions and simulate the operation of intelligent lifting systems.

resources: SPA Design Simulation Software (e.g., SolidWorks, COMSOL)
Pneumatic Experiment Kit and Measurement Equipment (Pressure Sensors, Displacement Sensors)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
